info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 11:09PM MDT until June 25 at 1:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and arroyo flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Far southern Dona Ana County in New Mexico, and far northwestern El Paso County in Texas. Portions of south central New Mexico, including the following county, Dona Ana and western Texas, including the following county, El Paso.
* WHEN...Until 100 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor urban flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1109 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of up to 0.5 to 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Anthony in Texas and New Mexico, and Chaparral.
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MDT WEDNESDAY

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; El Paso, TX
